title: 108_hr1204
content: The National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966 is amended to include a new section on concession contracts for buildings, facilities, and properties within the system. The National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966 is amended to include a new section on concession contracts for commercial activities providing accommodations, facilities, or services to visitors on lands or waters in the System. The Secretary must authorize the use of land or water for such activities only through contracts that comply with specified requirements and are awarded through a competitive bidding process. This does not apply to certain mandated or authorized administrative sites, visitor facilities, or revenue-producing services. The National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966 is amended to include a new section on concession contracts for commercial activities providing accommodations, facilities, or services to visitors on lands or waters in the System. The purpose is to offer recreational, educational, or interpretive enjoyment to visitors, excluding certain activities like procurement contracts, volunteer services, governmental activities, operation of a bookstore by a Friends organization, and guide or outfitter services authorized by the Secretary. The Secretary will issue regulations for standardized contracts under the National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966, allowing provisions other than specified if approved in writing and addressing specific circumstances. Contracts must ensure activities are compatible and designed to conserve natural and cultural resources. The Secretary will issue regulations for standardized contracts under the National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966 to facilitate visitor enjoyment of lands and waters, enhance knowledge of natural resources, and authorize maintenance and repair of improvements by contract holders. Maintenance and repair costs incurred by contract holders will be considered as payment for land or water use. The United States retains title to all real property maintained or repaired under the contract. No compensable interest is granted for maintenance activities, repairs, construction, or improvements on the land or water in the System. Expenditure of fees and payments received by the United States for use of real property is authorized. The Secretary can use fees and payments received for the use of real property in the System for maintenance, repair, and enhancement projects at the refuge or refuge complex. This includes backlogged repair and maintenance projects, interpretation, signage, habitat or facility enhancement, and administration of agreements, leases, permits, or contracts. The Secretary can use fees and payments for maintenance, repair, and enhancement projects at the refuge. This includes administration of agreements, leases, permits, and contracts. The Act of June 15, 1935, known as the Refuge Revenue Sharing Act, applies to amounts not expended by the Secretary. The National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966 applies to concessions awarded or renewed after specific dates. The Secretary of the Interior must issue regulations for program requirements within 18 months of the enactment of this Act. The comprehensive conservation plan for each refuge must include activities allowed under concession contracts. Prior Amendments Not Affected - This section does not impact any amendments made by the National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966 before this Act, or any laws amended by that section. SEC. 2. ANNUAL REPORT ON NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE CONCESSIONS. The National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966 is amended to require an annual report on concession activities in the system. The Secretary must submit an annual report to specific committees on concessions activities in the National Wildlife Refuge System, detailing the number of refuge units with concessions, services offered by concessionaires, types of legal arrangements, and payments received. The annual report on concessions activities in the National Wildlife Refuge System includes details on fees received, funds deposited into the refuge revenue sharing fund, terminated contracts, visitor service improvements, and backlogged repair and maintenance. The Secretary of the Interior must submit a report on completed backlogged repair and maintenance projects by concessionaires and volunteers within one year of the enactment of this Act. The House of Representatives passed the bill on November 18, 2003.
